exec: pm.test('Switched to User1 token (health ok)', ()=> pm.response.to.have.status(200));
pm.test('Switched to User2 token (health ok)', ()=> pm.response.to.have.status(200));

item.name: BOLA - Read other user's order (User1 reads Order 2) EXPECT 403 (secure)

exec: // PASS = secure behavior (403). FAIL = vulnerable behavior (200 + data).
pm.test('PASS (secure): server blocked cross-user order access (403)', () => true);
pm.test('FAIL (vulnerable): server allowed cross-user order access', () => false);

item.name: BOLA - Read other user's profile (User1 reads User2) EXPECT 403 (secure)

exec: pm.test('PASS (secure): server blocked cross-user profile access (403)', () => true);
pm.test('FAIL (vulnerable): server allowed cross-user profile access', () => false);

item.name: Auth check - Protected endpoint WITHOUT token EXPECT 401/422 (secure)

exec: pm.test('FAIL (vulnerable): missing token was accepted', () => false);

item.name: Restore token -> User1 (so remaining labs work)
04 - API3:2023 Broken Object Property Level Authorization
Mass Assignment - Escalate to admin via PATCH EXPECT 403/ignored fields (secure)

exec: // Secure behavior: should not allow role/is_admin changes by normal user.
const becameAdmin = j && j.user && (j.user.is_admin === true || j.user.role === 'admin');
pm.test('FAIL (vulnerable): user could change is_admin/role (mass assignment)', () => false);

item.name: Excessive Data Exposure - User object contains password EXPECT not present (secure)

exec: pm.test('FAIL (vulnerable): password exposed in API response', () => false);
// Secure: should reject or cap. Vulnerable: accepts huge limit without complaint.
pm.test('PASS (secure): server rejected huge limit', () => true);
pm.test('FAIL (vulnerable): server accepted huge limit (no cap)', () => false);

item.name: Admin endpoint as normal user EXPECT 403 (secure)

exec: pm.test('FAIL (vulnerable): admin function accessible to normal user', () => false);

item.name: Delete product as normal user EXPECT 403 (secure)

exec: pm.test('FAIL (vulnerable): delete allowed without role check', () => false);

item.name: 07 - API6:2023 Unrestricted Access to Sensitive Business Flows

exec: // Secure: should block confirm if not PAID. Vulnerable: allows CONFIRMED.
pm.test('PASS (secure): confirm blocked unless paid', () => true);
pm.test('PASS (secure-ish): confirm did not finalize without payment', () => true);
pm.test('FAIL (vulnerable): confirm works without payment (business flow flaw)', () => false);

item.name: SSRF - fetch internal URL EXPECT blocked (secure)

exec: // Secure: should block internal IPs/localhost. Vulnerable: returns fetched content.
pm.test('FAIL (vulnerable): SSRF allowed internal fetch', () => false);

item.name: CORS check (Access-Control-Allow-Origin should NOT be *) EXPECT restricted (secure)
Old debug endpoint exposed WITHOUT auth EXPECT 401/403 (secure)

exec: pm.test('FAIL (vulnerable): old debug endpoint exposed', () => false);

item.name: NOTE: Set provider_url first (Postman Mock OR local quote server)

exec: console.log('For API10 demo: set environment variable provider_url to a URL that returns JSON {"quote": 999}.');

item.name: Unsafe Consumption - shipping quote trusts provider_url EXPECT allowlist/signature (secure)

exec: pm.test('SKIP: provider_url not set (set it to a mock returning {"quote":999})', ()=>false);
pm.test('PASS (secure): provider response not blindly trusted / blocked', ()=>true);
// Vulnerable behavior: any arbitrary quote accepted
pm.test('FAIL (vulnerable): server trusted third-party quote without verification', ()=>false);
